intro: Dianthera arvensis, commonly known as the field dianthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or white. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it often grows in disturbed soils in open habitats. Dianthera arvensis is an annual herb that thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural fields and along roadsides.
